items.preText: 3.14pm The Bangladesh players disperse from the huddle after some talk from Mashrafe, and the New Zealand openers stretch their arms while walking out. Mashrafe will open the bowling again, Guptill will take strike with one slip in place. Can Bangladesh make a match out of this? Let's see...
items.text: length delivery a fair bit outside off, left alone easily
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Guptill, no run

items.text: touch closer to off but wide enough to be left alone again
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Guptill, no run

items.text: 126kmh, on length and towards off stump this time, blocked on the front foot
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Guptill, no run

items.text: punches the shorter ball off the back foot, not much bounce, and they take three as cover and mid-off chase
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Guptill, 3 runs

items.text: around the off stump with a bit of angle, he blocks on the off side
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Nicholls, no run

items.text: towards the pads and it's tucked away square on the leg side and they take two
items.postText: Varun Shetty will take over now
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Nicholls, 2 runs

items.text: nice looking chip, but it's only just cleared mid-off. Length ball swings away in the corridor and he leans in on the front foot to tap this over the infield. That might have stuck in the pitch a little
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Guptill, 2 runs

items.text: short of a length outswinger outside off, looks to cut, mistimes and gets it into the covers off the under-edge
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Guptill, no run

items.text: short of a length on leg stump, thigh height. Stays tall and picks it over square leg
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Guptill, FOUR runs

items.text: length and swung away outside off. Defended into the covers
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Guptill, no run

items.text: length at off, looks to whip through midwicket and gets an inside edge
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Guptill, no run

items.text: slapped away. Short of a length and very wide outside off. Gets a half stride forward and belts it in front of point
items.postText: Richard Mutch: "Just tuning in now. Was there an injury or rain delay? Did NZ just take 4 hours to bowl their 50 overs? Perhaps the strict guidelines on getting thru your 20 overs quickly in the T20's are contributing to teams (worldwide) taking a more relaxed approach to overates in in tests and ODI's?" --- There was a rain relay in the middle and an injury break too.
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Guptill, FOUR runs

items.preText:
Readers from the US can watch the 2nd ODI LIVE here, on ESPN+

Mashrafe around the wicket

items.postText: Kieran: "Little disappointed that NZ chose to bowl first. Smart choice for this game, maybe not so much for the World Cup preparation, with games running out. NZ really needs to test the batting at putting on a big score, at pace (especially top order). between 250 to 300 scoring rate won't cut it against the best teams. If BDesh win toss and bats first in the last game we have missed our chance to test the batting unless BDesh manage a really big score."
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Guptill, no run

items.text: short of a length just outside off, guided to point's right with an open face
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Nicholls, 1 run
